text:
Hi everyone,

I am building an app locally and making use of Private App and the API documentation that exists. What I want to achieve is to pull all tickets created or updated today and sync them to my local DB every day.

The number of tickets we have on HubSpot is large, and trying to pull all tickets daily is not sustainable. I prefer a situation whereby I can pull all and sync the tickets created or updated per day at the end of that day to my local DB. How can I limit the returned data by the date created or the date updated?

The referenced API is GET /crm-objects/v1/objects/tickets/paged

Hi everyone and <@U01D4JTE8R4>,

How to delete or archive custom property in HubSpot which are already used in non-HubSpot form?
I think I would use /crm/v3/objects/tickets/search and add a search filter for the create date to get what you want.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/tickets>
If a webpage was accidently deleted, what is the process of recovering the deleted webpage?
Has anyone had luck in exporting the call transcripts from Coaching Playlists? It would be great to pass these into something like chatGPT to uncover trends and make recommendations.

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
